Description: Cypriot terracotta model of a wheeled quadruped, probably a horse or centaur (head missing). Handmade body with pierced holes for axles of wheels on base. Traces of yellow paint around waist and on tail. Cream/buff colour fabric with fine black and red (grog?) inclusions.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Temple of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ16 or 17
Curator's comments: No exact parallels can be found, though this is most likely a toy centaur or horse similar in form to other wheeled horse, centaur and cavalry figurines of the Cypro Archaic II period. For examples from Cyprus, see Karageorghis 1996, 7 particularly figs 4, 5 pl. 5.3 Type A15; also Monloup 1994 nos 575-600 for examples of wheeled figurines of various types from what was likely to be a sanctuary dump in Salamis. Karageorghis, V. 1996. The coroplastic art of ancient Cyprus.VI. The Cypro-Archaic Period monsters, animals and miscellanea. Nicosia, University of Cyprus. Monloup, T. 1994, Salamine de Chypre XII. Les figurines de terre cuite de tradition archaïque (Paris: De Boccard).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DA.072) (Phase 1)
